required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Interval and Resistance Exercise on Physiological and Psychological Parameters.
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Interval and Resistance Exercise on Physiological and Psychological Parameters.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the physiological and psychological effects of a sprint interval and resistance training intervention on females.

detailed_description.textblock: Females aged 20-65 will attend 10 weeks of exercise training consisting of sprint interval training and resistance training for 30 sessions. We will examine changes in body composition, blood panel (fasting glucose, cholesterol, triglycerides), strength (bench press and back squat), aerobic capacity and psychological parameters (hardiness, affect, enjoyment, perception and self-regulation). The effects will be measured acutely after the program and 6-months after the cessation of the program.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: All subjects will participate in an exercise intervention consisting of sprint interval training and resistance training.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in fat mass at 13 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Changes in Fat mass in Kg assessed by idexa

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in fat mass at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Changes in Fat mass in Kg assessed by idexa

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in lean mass at 13 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Changes in Lean mass in Kg assessed by idexa

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in lean mass at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Changes in Lean mass in Kg assessed by idexa

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in visceral fat at 13 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Changes in Visceral Fat in Kg assessed by idexa

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in visceral fat at 13 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Changes in Visceral Fat in Kg assessed by idexa

primary_outcome.measure: Participate perception of the program post
primary_outcome.description: Interviews to assess participants perception of the program

primary_outcome.measure: Participate perception of the program retention
primary_outcome.description: Interviews to assess participants perception of the program

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in bench press at 13 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in bench press measured in Kg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in back squat at 13 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in back squat measured in Kg

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes in fasting blood glucose at 13 weeks
Changes in fasting blood glucose at 6 months

arm_group.description: Participants will complete 10 weeks of a SIT and resistance training paradigm.

intervention.description: Participants complete 30 sessions of sprints and resistance training. Outcomes are assessed acutely and at 6 months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- This population consists of: females, aged 25-55, who are: sedentary (not reporting a regular schedule of exercise over the last 3 months), and able to start an exercise program (assessed by the PARQ+)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Females who are below age 25 or over age 55, who are currently exercising and have existing conditions that would exclude them from exercise.

patient_data.ipd_description: No IPD will be shard with other researchers.
